intro: Astragalus holopsilus, commonly known as the silvery milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces distinctive, hairy pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus holopsilus is adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in dry, sandy soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in its native habitat.
